intro: Adenostemma lavenia var. reticulatum, commonly known as the net-veined adenostemma, is a flowering plant native to parts of Africa and the Arabian Peninsula. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves with a distinct reticulate venation pattern. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically pink or purple in color. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in rocky soils and open woodlands. This variant is notable for its ornamental value and is sometimes cultivated for its attractive foliage and blooms.
